page.title: 04WOOD HALL FARM.
page.content: Wood Hall farm is one of four farms in the area concentrating on arable farming, it lies about half a mile North of the village of Cridling Stubbs. It is a family run concern , with the main crops being Corn,Sugar Beet,and Potatoes. They have a limited amount of machinery, eg.Tractor and a Combined Harvester, and only employ outside help at the really busy times such as harvesting. The farm itself is of ancient origin, dating back to the Fourteenth Century. Remains of its Medieval Moat are still in evidence.Such defences required a special licence from the King,which suggests the owner was a person of note.
